sentence.Network_en: The attractiveness of the schemes depends almost entirely on tax relief.
sentence.Network_cn: 该方案之所以吸引人几乎全倚仗其税费减免政策。

sentence.Network_en: There is nothing wrong with journalists commenting on the attractiveness of artists.
sentence.Network_cn: 记者评论艺术家的个人魅力无可厚非。

sentence.Network_en: The forest will enhance the attractiveness of the region.
sentence.Network_cn: 这片森林会为该地区平添更多魅力。

entry.def: A person who is attractive is pleasant to look at.

example.tran: 她是个妩媚动人的女子。

example.ex: I thought he was very attractive and obviously very intelligent...
example.tran: 我觉得他魅力非凡，才智过人。

entry.def: Something that is attractive has a pleasant appearance or sound.

example.ex: The flat was small but attractive, if rather shabby...
example.tran: 虽然有些老旧，这仍不失为一个漂亮的小公寓。

example.ex: The creamy white flowers are attractive in the spring.
example.tran: 在春天，这种乳白色的花朵分外迷人。

entry.tran: 吸引人的;值得拥有（或做）的
entry.def: You can describe something as attractive when it seems worth having or doing.

example.ex: Co-operation was more than just an attractive option, it was an obligation...
example.tran: 合作不仅仅是诱人的选择，它也是一种责任。

example.ex: Smoking is still attractive to many young people who see it as glamorous.
example.tran: 吸烟对很多年轻人还是很有诱惑力，他们觉得这让自己显得魅力十足。

means.word_mean: 1. the quality of arousing interest; being attractive or something that attracts;

sentences.sentence: "her personality held a strange attraction for him"

means.word_mean: 2. a beauty that appeals to the senses
